availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Kentucky attorney and politician. Educated at Transylvania University and the University of Virginia, leaving in 1829 to study law under Judge John Boyle in Boyle County, Kentucky. Graduated from the Transylvania University Law Department in 1831. Member of the Whig Party and Democratic Party. Worked in trading and land speculation from 1831 to 1842. Opened law practice in Flemingsburg, Kentucky in 1842. Elected and served in the Kentucky House of Representatives in 1841 and 1846. Served as county judge of Fleming County from 1850 to 1854. Served as a delegate to the 1840 and 1852 national conventions of the Whig Party. Re-elected to the Kentucky House of Representatives in 1862. Elected and served in the Kentucky Senate from 1863 to 1867.

bibl.p: The Biographical Encyclop√¶dia of Kentucky of the Dead and Living Men of the Nineteenth Century, vol. 1 (Cincinnati: J. M. Armstrong & Company, 1878), 635; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District No 1, p. 58.
